[4] de Clippel, G., The type-agent core for exchange economies with asymmetric information, Journal of Economic Theory, 135, (2007), 144-158.
[5] de Clippel, G., Equity, envy and efficiency under asymmetric information, Economics Letters 99, (2008), 265-267.
[6] Foley, D., Resource allocation and the public sector, Yale Econ. Essays 7, (1967), 45-98.
[7] Gabszewicz, J.J., Coalitinal fairness of allocations in pure exchange economies. Econometrica, Vol.3, No. 4 (1975), 661-668.
[8] Gajdos, T. and Tallon, J.M., Fairness under Uncertainty, Economics Bulletin 4, (2002), 1-7.
[9] Graziano, M.G. and Pesce, M., Fairness under Uncertainty, Meditherranean Journal of Mathematics, (forthcoming).
[10] Harsanyi, J.C., Games with incomplete information played by Bayesian players. Manage. Sci., 14 (1967-1968), 159-182, 320-334, 486- 502.
[11] Palfrey, T. and Srivastava, S., On Bayesian implementable allocations, Review of Economic Studies 54, (1987), 193-208.
[12] Pazner, E. and Schmeidler, D., A difficulty in the concept of fairness. Review of Economic Studies 41, (1974), 441-443.
[13] Pesce, M., On mixed markets with asymmetric information, Economic Theory, doi:10.1007/s00199-009-0453-1.
[14] Varian, H., Equity, envy and efficiency. Journal of Economic Theory, 9, (1974), 63-91.
[15] Vind, K., Lecture notes for economics. Stanford University, Spring , 288 (1971).
[16] Wilson, R., Information, efficiency, and the core of an economy. Econometrica, 46, (1978), 807-816.

[17] Yannelis, N.C., Value and fairness, in C.D. Aliprantis, O. Burkinshaw and N.J. Rothman, eds. Advances in Equilibrium Theory (Springer Verlag, Berlin, Heidelberg, New York, Tokyo), (1985), 205- 235.
[18] Yannelis, N.C., The core of an economy with differential information, Economic Theory, 1, (1991), 183-198.
[19] Zhou L., Strictly fair allocations in large exchange economies, Journal of Economic Theory, 57, (1992), 158-175.
